intro: Ouratea salicifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are broad and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds.
